    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Torrecuevas aqueduct
    One of five Roman-era aqueducts known from Sexi (modern Almuñécar, Spain). This one is represented by an extant aqueduct bridge located near the source of the Rio Verde, north of Sexi.
    Creators: P.O. Spann
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: modified OSM Location of aqueduct bridge (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance, Baseline created)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Torre del Breny
    A monumental Roman tomb of likely third century date located in the modern town of Castellgalí, between Barcelona and Manresa in Catalunya. Purportedly also known as the "Torre dels Dimonis" (Devil's Tower), it has no known ancient name.
    Creators: H.S. Sivan; R.W. Mathisen; S.J. Keay
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: modified OSM Location of Torre del Breny (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Torre de los Escipiones
    A first century AD tower tomb built 6 km from Tarraco, the Torre dels Escipions has been listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
    Creators: H.S. Sivan; R.W. Mathisen; S.J. Keay
    Contributors: Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: corrected typo in summary; fixed typo in summary; modified OSM location of Torre dels Escipions (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Torre Galli

  • Torre Mordillo

    Creators: A.M. Small; I.E.M. Edlund Berry

  • Torvaianica
    A Roman villa near Pomezia discovered in 2006. The rich remains of the villa were uncovered along with at least 69 tombs.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:

  • Tractus Umbriae
    According to Pliny the Elder, the Tractus Umbriae was the coastal territory near the mouth of the Umbro that was originally settled by the Umbri. It was located between Saena and Telamo.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:
    Modifications: update reference
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker

  • Trebula Balli(ni)ensium
    An ancient city of Campania that became enfranchised in the Roman system in the late fourth century B.C.
    Creators: N. Purcell
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: create DARMC citation to preserve cross-project linkage after retracting DARMC location; created OSM location of Trebula Baliensis
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Tredici Altari
    A Latin federal sanctuary at Lavinium, consisting of a series of altars that range in date from the sixth to the second century BC and a sacred site (or heroon) connected with the hero Aeneas.
    Creators: L. Quilici; S. Quilici Gigli
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: reference; update references; modified OSM location of Tredici Altari (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Tretos
    From Hesiod onward, Greek writers locate the Nemean lion in a cave or ravine in this mountain and explain the mountain's name ("perforated") from being split by the ravine. Wiseman (in PECS, whence ToposText) identifies the Tretos as "the mountain on the W side of the main road between Kleonaia-Corinthia and Argolis" and the ravine as the modern Dervenakia pass. Camp in BAtlas silently suppresses this view, and mentioning "Tretos" only in a list of "unlocated" features in the map-by-map directory where we cites only Pausanias and glosses: "Corinthia-Argolis: pass, road".
    Creators: G. Reger; J. McK. Camp II
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert
    Modifications: removed BAtlas reference, since this feature does not appear on the map; summary; place type -= unlocated; added BAtlDir reference; Pausanias reference -> evidence; update references; created OSM location of Dervenakia
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Trevignano
    Trevignano Romano, located on the shores of Lake Bracciano, lies some 47 km from Rome. Archaeological evidence for Etruscan occupation, in the form of tombs dating to the eighth - sixth centuries B.C., has been discovered to the north of the modern town. A medieval castle was built there under Innocent III ca. 1200.
    Creators: W.V. Harris
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: update references; modified name "Trevignano Romano" (update reference)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Tribola
    According to Dionysius of Halicarnassus, Tribola (or Tribula) is an early city in central Italy, now unlocated. Dionysius claims it was some sixty stades from Reate.
    Creators: W.V. Harris
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert

  • Tropaeum Augusti/Alpium Tropaeum/Alpis Summa/Alpis Maritima
    A victory monument built by Augustus (5 B.C.) to commemorate the subjugation of the tribes of the western Alps. The Romans considered the spot to be "In Alpe Maritima".
    Creators: R. Häussler; S. Loseby
    Contributors: Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Ryan Horne; Stefano Costa; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: update references; modified OSM location of Tropaeum Alpium (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance, Baseline created)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Tropaeum Traiani (settlement)
    Civitas Tropaensium was a Roman castrum settled by Roman veterans of the Dacian Wars. Constantine I rebuilt the city after it was destroyed by the Goths and it survived until the Avars sacked it in A.D. 587.
    Creators: A.G. Poulter
    Contributors: Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Civitas Tropaensium (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker

  • Tunes
    Tunes was a Libyan city in Africa Proconsularis. Rome prevailed in a land battle south of Tunes in 256 BC during the First Punic War.

  • Turris Libisonis
    A settlement of northwestern Sardinia, located at the mouth of the Mannu River. The site served as a port in Phoenician, Carthaginian, and Roman phases of occupation. The modern Porto Torres stands on the site, about 10 miles distant from Sassari.
    Creators: S.L. Dyson
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: create DARMC citation to preserve cross-project linkage after retracting DARMC location; created OSM location of Area Archeologica di Turris Libisonis
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott

    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Tutienses cf. Tutia/Tutienses
    "Tutienses" refers to an ancient tribe of Latium included in Pliny's geographical accounting of Roman Italy. In compiling this entry for the Barrington Atlas, N. Purcell has indicated that reference also be made to the toponym "Tutia fl.", a river discussed by Livy in the twenty-sixth book of his history. During the Second Punic War Hannibal realized that his chances of capturing the city of Rome herself were dwindling. At that point, Hannibal moved his camp back to the river Tutia, located 6 miles from the city (sex milia passuum ab urbe). Hannibal proceeded from that point to the grove of Feronia located at the foot of Mt. Soracte in South Etruria.
    Creators: N. Purcell
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert
    Modifications: created connection "Latium (region)"
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Tuvixeddu Punic necropolis
    A Punic necropolis near Caralis in Sardinia.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors: Tom Elliott
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Parco della Necropoli punica di Tuvixeddu-Tuvumannu (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)

  • Uchi Maius

  • *Umbro (river)
    The Ambra flows from the foot of Monte Luco to the Arno river.
    Creators: W.V. Harris
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert
    Modifications: add TM GEO ID 52824: Umbro (Ambra)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Umma
    Umma was an important ancient city of Sumer but has not been scientifically excavated. The mainstream of scholarly opinion associates the ancient site with Tell Jokha, Iraq, located in Iraq's Northwestern Dhi Qar Governorate. This area is remote and is associated with a network of ancient canals. Tell Jokha measures about 1,500 meters in diameter.
    Creators: B. Siewert-Mayer; H. Kopp; W. Röllig
    Contributors: Carolin Johansson; Eric Kansa; Francis Deblauwe; Jeffrey Becker; Jamie Novotny; Ryan Horne; Rune Rattenborg; Sean Gillies
    Modifications: created CIGS location of Tall Jūka; created name "Tall Jūka"
    Actors: Carolin Johansson; Tom Elliott

  • Uragh Stone Circle
    A stone circle measuring 33 by 26 feet with 11 standing stones located near Gleninchaquin Park, Tuosist, County Kerry, Ireland.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:
    Modifications: created connection "Hibernia"
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Ureu
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 32 E3 Ureu
    Creators: R.B. Hitchner
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: update references
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Uronarti
    An ancient settlement located on an island in the Nile just south of the Second Cataract, now in the north of Sudan. An ancient fortress dating to the reigns of the Middle Kingdom pharaohs (19th century BC) Senusret I and Senusret III is found there.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors: Sean Gillies
    Modifications: created OSM location of Uronarti; created connection "Nilus (river)"
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Uruk/Orchoe/Erech/Orikut
    Uruk was an ancient Sumerian (and later Babylonian) city located on the Euphrates river. At its height (ca. 2900 BC), Uruk's population may have topped 50,000 people and its walls enclosed an area of more than six square kilometers, making it the largest city in the world at that point in time.
    Creators: A. Hausleiter; M. Roaf; R. Wenke; St J. Simpson
    Contributors: Eric Kansa; Francis Deblauwe; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; B. Siewert-Mayer; DARMC; H. Kopp; P. Flensted Jensen; R. Talbert; W. Röllig
    Modifications: added Le Doaré 2023
    Actors: Tom Elliott
  • Urvinum Hortense
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 42 D3 Urvinum Hortense
    Creators: W.V. Harris
    Contributors: Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: added references: Varona Rubio 2020 and Ciafardini 2021; create DARMC citation to preserve cross-project linkage after retracting DARMC location; modified OSM location of Urvinum Hortense (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Tom Elliott
  • Uthina
    Uthina was a town in the province of Africa Proconsularis with Roman colonial status.
    Creators: R.B. Hitchner
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: add TM GEO ID 11846: Uthina (Oudhna)

  • Utica
    A Punic center located west of Carthage.
    Creators: R.B. Hitchner
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Elizabeth Fentress; Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert; R. Warner

  • Vada Volaterrana

    Actors: Tom Elliott
  • Vaga
    Vaga (Béja, Tunisia) was a much-contested city in antiquity. During the conflict against Rome, Iugurtha made Vaga his base of operations.
    Creators: R.B. Hitchner
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: update references

  • Vaison-la-Romaine Roman Bridge
    The Roman bridge at Vaison-la-Romaine is supposedly dated to the first century CE.
    Creators: S. Loseby
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert
    Modifications: edit title, summary, add refs = wikipedia (fr), wikidata; update references; modified OSM location of Pont Romain (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance, Baseline created, update title, summary)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Valseni
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 24 unlocated Valseni
    Creators: E.W. Haley
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert
    Modifications: update references
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Vapheio Tholos Tomb
    The Vapheio Tholos Tomb is a Mycenaean tholos built around 1500 BC that is assumed to have held an elite burial or burials. It is best known for the two golden Minoan-style cups it housed.
    Creators: Michael Horst
    Contributors: Adam Rabinowitz; Brady Kiesling; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; Dalton Parish; Elise Johnson; Emily van Zanten; Michael Horst
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Θολωτός τάφος Βαφειού (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • *Varatedo
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 14 E4 *Varatedo
    Creators: H.S. Sivan; R.W. Mathisen
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert

    Actors: Jeffrey Becker

  • Vasio
    Vasio (modern Vaison-la-Romaine) was the civitas capital of the Vocontii and eventually received Roman status by the late first century BC.
    Creators: S. Loseby
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: update references; modified OSM location of archaeological area of Villasse (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance, Baseline created)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Vaticanus Mons
    A hill located across the Tiber from Rome's traditional seven hills, the Vaticanus Mons now lies within the territory of Vatican City.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Vatican Hill (Reimported full node geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Vatl/Vetulonia
    The Etruscan Vatluna resisted Rome's influence in the seventh century, although the city may have been the source of Rome's adoption of the curule chair and the fasces.
    Creators: W.V. Harris
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: references; references; add reference; modified OSM location of 'Scavi di città' archaeological area (Reimported full node geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Vegesela
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 33 C2 Vegesela
    Creators: R.B. Hitchner
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: update reference

  • Vegesela
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 34 F2 Vegesela
    Creators: E.W.B. Fentress
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: update reference
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Veii
    An important city of South Etruria located north-northwest of Rome, Veii was eventually sacked by the Romans in 396 B.C. The ancient city covered some 180 ha.
    Creators: L. Quilici; S. Quilici Gigli
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: add references; add Campana 2023
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Velefi
    An ancient settlement or road station attested in the Peutinger Map, but otherwise unknown and unlocateable. The map places it together with several other unlocated places on a route in modern Algeria between Gadifaula (modern Ksar Sbehi) and Vatari (which might be modern Fedj es Siouda).
    Creators: E.W.B. Fentress
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: update reference; modified name "Velefi" (edited)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Velienses
    The Velienses number among the 53 peoples of Latium Vetus that Pliny the Elder records as having perished without leaving a trace (interiere sine vestigiis).
    Creators: N. Purcell
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert
    Modifications: reference
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Veliocasses
    An ancient people, tribe, or cultural group.
    Creators: C. Haselgrove; J. Kunow
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Michael Heubel; Ryan Horne; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert; Richard Talbert
    Modifications: update reference; modified name "Veliocasses" (Baseline created, Latin name, Pliny reference)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Velitrae
    Velitrae (modern Velletri) was an ancient Volscian settlement. In the Roman Republican period, Velitrae was attacked by Marcus Furius Camillus (379 B.C.) and again by Cincinnatus (377 B.C.); the Romans controlled the site by 365 B.C. The gens Octavia hailed from the city and a youthful Octavian spent time there.
    Creators: L. Quilici; S. Quilici Gigli
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: created name "Veliterni"
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Venice
    The city of Venice in northern Italy.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:
    Modifications: update references
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker

    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 20 F4 ‘Vereis’

  • Via Francigena

    Contributors:

    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Via Ostiensis
    An ancient road running from Rome to Ostia, exiting the city walls of Rome at the Porta Trigemina.
    Creators: L. Quilici; S. Quilici Gigli
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; L. Quilici and S. Quilici Gigli; R. Talbert
    Modifications: update references; update references
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Via Tiburtina
    An ancient road heading east-northeast from Rome to Tibur.
    Creators: L. Quilici; S. Quilici Gigli

  • Villa Arianna
    The so-called "Villa Arianna" at Stabiae is typically considered one of the earliest villas at the site and is often dated to the second century B.C.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Villa Arianna (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Villa Carmiano
    A villa rustica of about 400 square meters that was discovered at Stabiae in 1963. The site was reinterred in 1998.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Villa Romana Carmiano (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Villa degli Antonini
    The so-called 'Villa of the Antonines', located near Genzano di Roma in the Alban Hills, lies just south of the Via Appia between the road's 18th and 19th milestones.
    Creators: L. Quilici; S. Quilici Gigli
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Villa degli Antonini (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Villa della Pisanella
    A Roman villa rustica at Boscoreale that was first discovered in 1868 by Modestino Pulzella. The villa is best known as the findspot of the so-called "Boscoreale Treasure". Following excavation, the remains of the villa were reinterred.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:
    Modifications: update references
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Villa de Río Verde
    A Roman villa with mosaic pavements located in the modern Spanish province of Malaga.
    Creators: F.H. Stanley; Jr.; R.C. Knapp
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Villa romana de Río Verde (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Villa di Monte delle Colonnacce
    A Roman villa located near Castel di Guido.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:

    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Villa di Nerone
    Nero built a villa and a port at Antium. The villa was subsequently expanded under Domitian and other later emperors.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Villa di Nerone (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker

  • Village of the Kardakoi
    Originally settled by members of the Seleucid military near Telmessos, the town was eventually absorbed into the Attalid Kingdom. Its precise location is not known today.
    Creators: Ryan Horne
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
    Modifications: edited
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker

  • Villa of the Octavii
    The archaeological remains of a Roman villa on the hill of San Cesareo are speculatively identified as belonging to the gens Octavia, according to Della Portella 2004 op. cit.
    Creators: L. Quilici; S. Quilici Gigli
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: add vici.org reference
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Villa Pamphili
    The church of San Pancrazio was founded in the sixth century A.D. by Pope Symmachus. It stands beyond the Porta San Pancrazio on the Ianiculum. Below the church is a massive catacomb referred to as S. Pancrazio or Ottavilla.
    Creators: L. Quilici; S. Quilici Gigli
    Contributors: Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: edited; modified OSM location of Basilica di San Pancrazio (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance, place type -> church); created name "Coemeterium Pamphili"; created name "Villa Pamphili"
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Villard-Notre-Dame
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 17 G3 Villard-Notre-Dame
    Creators: E. Bertrand
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: updated Zotero URI for Barruol 1969
    Actors: Tom Elliott
  • Villa Rufinella
    The Villa Rufinella stands on the site of a terraced Roman villa. The site occupies one of the most commanding positions on the slope above what is now Frascati, placing it in the ancient environs of Tusculum.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:
    Modifications: modified OSM location of grounds of Villa Tuscolana (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Villa San Marco
    The Villa San Marco originates in the Augustan period and was subsequently expanded during the reign of Claudius. Its owner may have been a freedman of Claudius.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors: Tom Elliott
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Villa San Marco (Reimported full node geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Villa S. Silvestro
    The remains of a Republican temple podium now support a Christian church at Villa S. Silvestro in Umbria. The temple's podium likely dates, in its first phase, to the third century B.C.
    Creators: W.V. Harris
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: create DARMC citation to preserve cross-project linkage after retracting DARMC location; update references; created OSM location of Villa San Silvestro Roman temple
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Villa Torlonia

  • Vi(v)atia
    An ancient settlement of Hispania, identified with modern Baeza in the province of Jaén, Andalusia, Spain.

  • Volcei
    Volcei (modern Buccino) was an ancient city of Lucania that was subjugated by the Romans in 209 BC.
    Creators: A.M. Small; I.E.M. Edlund Berry
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Archaeological site of Volcei (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Tom Elliott
  • Volsinii
    Volsinii, also referred to as Volsinii Novi, is thought to be the settlement where Rome resettled the survivors of the Volsinian rebellion of 264 BCE. This episode is discussed by Zonaras (8. 7. 8). A late republican center at Bolsena, Italy, with civic architecture (forum) and domus has been excavated since 1946 by the École Française and is identified as Volsinii Novi.
    Creators: W.V. Harris
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: edited; summary; add OCD reference; add Broise et al. 1995; add TGN 8724001: Volsinii Novi (inhabited place); created OSM location of Volsinii Novi; created name "Volsinii Novi"
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Vorgium
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 7 C3 Vorgium
    Creators: P. Galliou
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: update references
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Vounari
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 72 D2 Vounari
    Creators: D. Rupp
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: add topostext
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Vouni
    Vouni is located on the northwest coast of Cyprus, some 7 km west of Soloi. The rocky hill was occupied in antiquity and the settlement included a fortified palace enclosure, the ancient name of which is unknown. According to PECS, the palace is to be dated ca. 500 to 380 BCE, with two main architectural phases (I: ca. 500 to 450 BCE, II: ca. 450 to 380 BCE).
    Creators: D. Rupp
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: created location "OSM location: Vouni Palace"
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Vulci
    Vulci (originally Velch or Velx in Etruscan) was an Etruscan city 80 km northwest of Rome. Vulci was one of the duodecim populi Etruriae.
    Creators: W.V. Harris
    Contributors: Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: add Arachne Vulci Viterbo (Provinz), Italien
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker

  • Wall0005, Synagogue (Dura-Europos)
    Portion of the west wall of the Assembly Hall from Synagogue Phase 2 in Dura-Europos.
    Creators: Anne Chen
    Contributors: Kyle Conrau-Lewis; Tom Elliott
    Modifications: edited
    Actors: Anne Chen
  • Wall of Media
    The Wall of Media, also known as Mēdías teîchos or the Wall of Semiramis, at Habl as-Sahr is mentioned by Xenophon in the Anabasis as a defensive ditch at the Euphrates built on the orders of Artaxerxes in the fifth century BC.
    Creators: M. Roaf; St J. Simpson
    Contributors: Carolin Johansson; Jeffrey Becker; Rune Rattenborg; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert
    Modifications: edited; update references; created CIGS location of Ḥabl al-Ṣakhar; created name "Ḥabl al-Ṣakhar"
    Actors: Carolin Johansson; Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Wittenham Clumps
    Wittenham Clumps describes a group of small hills in the Thames Valley where archaeological remains of Iron Age hill forts have been identified.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors:
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Round Hill (Reimported full node geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Xanthos
    An ancient city of Lycia.
    Creators: C. Foss; S. Mitchell
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert

  • Xanthos/Sirbis (river)

    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Yazılıkaya (Hattusa)
    A sacred rock-cut sanctuary of the Hittites. The sanctuary was in use from the late sixteenth century B.C. Many of the reliefs date to the reigns of Tudhaliya IV and Suppiluliuma II in the late thirteenth century B.C.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors: Tom Elliott
    Modifications: added to details field; edited summary; edited; added Wikidata Q529923: Yazılıkaya; UWHS; modified OSM location of Yazılıkaya (Reimported full node geometry and updated provenance)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Yedikilise
    Destroyed Armenian monastery in the village of Bakraçlı where Urartian inscriptions have been found.
    Creators: Carolin Johansson; Rune Rattenborg
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
    Modifications: update references; modified OSM location of Yedi Kilise (Standardized title, Baseline created); modified name "Yedikilise" (time period, assoc modern); modified name "Varagavank" (time period, assoc modern); modified name "Bakraçlı" (time period, assoc modern)
    Actors: Carolin Johansson; Jeffrey Becker
  • Zacazama

  • Zagora
    Site of an Early Iron Age settlement on the western coast of the island of Andros (ninth-eighth centuries B.C.).
    Creators: G. Reger; J. Bennet
    Contributors: Andrew Cabaniss; Brady Kiesling; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert

  • Zakros
    A Minoan site in eastern Crete and the location of a Bronze Age palatial center.
    Creators: Jeffrey Becker
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Ryan Horne; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott
    Modifications: modified Imagery location of Zakros (update title, PAA)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Zama Regia/Zama *Maior
    Zama Regia/Zama *Maior in Africa Proconsularis was the site of the Battle of Zama on October 19, 202 B.C., at the close of the Second Punic War fought between Rome and Carthage.
    Creators: R.B. Hitchner
    Contributors: Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: edited; update reference; update reference; edited
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Zankle Krene
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 47 unlocated Zankle Krene
    Creators: R.J.A. Wilson
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert
    Modifications: updated references; created connection "Sicilia (island)"
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Zattara
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 31 H4 Zattara
    Creators: E.W.B. Fentress
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: update reference
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
  • Zawiyah
    Zāwiyah (also Zawiyeh) is a site in the middle Euphrates region in what was part of the ancient kingdom of Suhu. The city was situated on the north bank of the Euphrates, a few kilometers west of Sur Jureh and Gleieh. Like many towns and cities of the ancient kingdom of Suhu, Zāwiyah is now underwater; the area was flooded after the construction of the Haditha dam. The city's ancient name is not known.
    Creators: Jamie Novotny
    Contributors: Carolin Johansson; Jeffrey Becker; Rune Rattenborg
    Modifications: created CIGS location of Zawiyah; created name "Zawiyah"
    Actors: Carolin Johansson; Tom Elliott
  • Zea Limen
    The main naval harbor of the Peiraeus with 196 ship sheds.
    Creators: J.S. Traill
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert
    Modifications: add topostext; modified OSM location of Zea (Pasalimani) (certain); created OSM location of Zea (Pasalimani)
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Zela
    Zela (modern Zile, Turkey) was an important ancient city of north-central Asia Minor; Strabo claimed Semiramis had founded the site. Iulius Caesar prevailed in the Battle of Zela against Pharnaces II of The Kingdom of Pontus, coining the phrase "veni, vidi, vici".
    Creators: David Braund; T. Sinclair
    Contributors: Brady Kiesling; Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; Diane Braund; R. Talbert
    Modifications: create DARMC citation to preserve cross-project linkage after retracting DARMC location; created OSM location
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott
  • Zella
    An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 33 H2 Zella
    Creators: R.B. Hitchner
    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert; R. Warner
    Modifications: update reference
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker

    Contributors: Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; R. Talbert
    Modifications: modified OSM location of Temple of Zeus (Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance); created connection "Atabyrion (mountain)"
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker; Tom Elliott

  • Zimara
    Zimara was a fort located near the Euphrates river on the eastern frontier of the Roman empire.
    Creators: T.B. Mitford
    Contributors: Johan Åhlfeldt; Jeffrey Becker; Sean Gillies; Tom Elliott; DARMC; R. Talbert
    Modifications: update references
    Actors: Jeffrey Becker
